page.title: 19FARMING IN KINGS LANGLEY
page.content: {FARMING There are intensively managed areas of grassland. Cattle predominate, but there is a growing tendancy for their replacement by sheep. Crops are alfalfa and grain for feeding stock and recently rape for vegetable oil production. Both north and south of the canal there are areas of rough grazing for horses and cattle respectively. {HORTICULTURE} East of the canal, are smallholdings raising poultry and orchards growing cherries, plums and apples. West of the canal, a large "pick your own" market garden produces strawberries, black and red currants, gooseberries and raspberries in season.Also, a wide selection of vegetables comprised of broad, dwarf and runner beans, peas, sweetcorn and potatoes are available.
